data.title: Oracle Restaurants Summit 2024
data.meta_description: Thank you to all that attendees, sponsors and partners for attending the Oracle Restaurants Summit, formerly Food and Beverage Connect!
data.text:
General Session

AI, ML, and GenAI: Impactful Implementations

While the discussion around artificial intelligence (AI) has been going on for years, there has been a renewed level of enthusiasm since the introduction of generative AI. With capabilities such as offer optimization, dynamic pricing, employee engagement, and content creation, AI can drive competitive advantage and help you get new functionality to market faster. Learn about Oracle’s investments in this space and how the Simphony platform can accelerate the adoption and rollout of innovative AI solutions.

Customer Panel

Customer Panel: Business Integration in IoT, Edge Computing, and Software Distribution

With more real-time data demands, edge computing is increasingly essential to ensuring business continuity and performance in the modern restaurant operation. IT leaders across sectors will share their perspectives on where the industry is headed and what we can expect from tech innovators.

Customer Panel

Customer Panel: Operational Excellence in Destination-Dining and Entertainment Venues

Stadiums, theme parks, resorts, and destination-dining locales are strategically embedding digital touchpoints to improve guest and fan experiences throughout the journey. Hear from leaders across the sector on how this is playing out, where they’re realizing the biggest returns, and what challenges persist.

Customer Panel

Customer Panel: Operational Excellence in Quick Service and Travel

Digital orchestration is key to anticipating, managing, and optimizing customer journeys that are increasingly unpredictable and nonlinear. Hear from leaders in the QSR and travel sector on how they’re designing solutions that bring together self-service, BYOD, just walk out, and kitchen automation to empower the next generation of operational leaders and accelerate speed to value.

General Session

Digital Transformation Accelerators: People, Process, and Technology

Simon de Montfort Walker, executive vice president and general manager, Oracle Food and Beverage, opens the Restaurant Summit with a quick-hitting session on Oracle’s industry focus, key investments, and where we see customers successfully crossing the chasm of digital transformation.

General Session

Digital Transformation Platform Imperatives

Tim Brown, group vice president of global solution engineering for Oracle Food and Beverage, shares an in-depth review of Oracle’s industry strategy, portfolio investments and the next generation of technology solutions designed and delivered to optimize sales channels, acquisition and loyalty, operational excellence, and business integration.

General Session

Optimizing Sales Channels, Empowering Teams

Consumers want complete flexibility in how they discover and decide what and where to eat next. The volume and variety of owned and paid channels puts pressure on operations, particularly management and frontline staff, and challenges businesses to justify sales channel performance. Channel management will provide the tooling, visibility, and smarts to ensure processes are optimized for the KPIs most important to your business—whether that’s revenue, margin, new customer acquisition or a balanced mix of multiple priorities.
